comments.body: I know there was some discussion of creating a special "internal/system" namespace for labels/annotations we don't expect/want users to change. I think this is important. And the CLI could perhaps block changes to labels/annotations in that namespace unless some kind of flag like --force is passed on the command line. (Arguably it's the kind of thing that should require some kind of "administrator" permission, but I realize we're not thinking about multi-tenancy yet so that aspect probably doesn't matter right now.)

comments.body:
More ideas, based in part on #3576:
- We could support something like --image-version=foo, which would append a name suffix, create a label, and apply a tag to the image. That could decompose cleanly into several independent options (--name-suffix, label options, and a tag option).
- We might also want a --registry option.
